channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An incessant crackdown in Belarus hurls dozens of independent journalists into harsh prisons
University of Oregon issues alert after gunfire reported near campus

item.description: When Aaron Friar and his teenage daughter, Ellie, go missing in Medford, Oregon, Det. Bill Ford takes one of the suspects out for a cigarette break. I...

item.title: WATCH: Bison scratches itch on signpost in Yellowstone
item.description: A bison was spotted enjoying a satisfying scratch against a signpost in the snowy landscape of Yellowstone National Park.

item.title: WATCH: Octopus 'hugs' diver's camera during underwater encounter
item.description: A diver filmed an affectionate encounter with a Maori octopus that was seen gently embracing her camera near a pier in Rye, Australia.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (April 20)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: From the 60 Minutes Archive: Wounds of War
item.description: From 2017, 60 Minutes reports on the Syrian government’s destruction of hospitals.

item.title: Shining a light on Syria's civil war
item.description: Activist Mouaz Moustafa received thousands of photographs of civilians, allegedly tortured to death by the Assad regime, and shared them for the world...

item.title: Witness, 11, points to father's suspected killer: Sister's forbidden boyfriend
item.description: In an exclusive interview, with "48 Hours," Sierra Friar recalls the day her sister and father vanished.

item.title: Takeaways from AP’s report on pardoned Jan. 6 rioters being embraced in Republican politics
A prince and knight fall in love and the Supreme Court is asked to intervene
item.description: Some parents in a suburban Maryland county want to pull their children from elementary school classes that use books featuring LGBTQ characters.
